Players of the same color share control
Players of the same team are allies

Forged by the goodwill and generosity of nearly 30,000 souls - the legend says that digging under the crust of Credit Island will release the gentle souls trapped there for years.
Two bricktron villages in bird's eye view of each other connected by meandering paths. Thread carefully.
Quickly! The enemy is close by! Will you overcome your foes in the forest-peppered island of Komorebi?
Deep trenches scar the land of this region like the stark divides of the local bricktron settlements.
Aeons ago, a mysterious power created an explosion at the center of this once great landmass, leaving a crater and a few small islands orbiting each other.
At the center lies a plain where Bricktrons of all cultures congregate. Not all gatherings are peaceful, however.
Two bricktron villages on the banks watch across with suspicion. Who will dare claim the center?
This map was released with 0.2 that introduced Invasion mode. It is meant to stage a central point of defense.
Bricktrons bravely defend their land, but these twisted treeline are teeming with Corruptrons.
Nested in the central crater of Arecibo, the enemies could come from anywhere - with no obvious chokepoints to defend. Will your castle stand this ultimate test?
This map was featured in the Kickstarter Trailer. It features a pre-built castle to explore, and several secondary build areas.
High-perched Bricktrons look down upon their inferior brethrens. Will the lowly Bricktrons revolt?
A square kilometer surface to challenge the limits of your construction abilities. Requires high performance PC.
The tortuous landscape of this inhospitable island is a goulag for Bricktrons.
The inhabitants of Nova were masterful bridge builders. This archipelago is no welcoming place for Bricktrons afraid of heights.
Perched on your heightened plateau, fend off attacks from three different fronts.
The crater in the middle of these twisted landmasses has served as the arena to many battles.
Several slopes at varying altitude make this the perfect island to build tall, vertical castles.
Empty Map with a Forest Biome.
Empty Map with a Desert Biome.
Empty Map with a Winter Biome.
Delicate flowers grow on the slopes of this mountain, honoring ancient warriors who once fought glorious battles here.
Brave bricktron pioneers find themselves in unfamiliar new lands. What danger awaits them on the other side of this winding passage?
A great mountain stands tall in the center of this frozen land, looming over the bricktrons below. Will they dare to climb it and claim its peak?

<color=#ffc50a>This is your Home Crystal</color>. Protect it at all costs!
- Use the <color=#ffc50a>W, A, S and D</color> keys to move the camera around.

- Hold the <color=#ffc50a>Middle Mouse Button</color> to rotate the camera in any angle. \n
- You can also use the <color=#ffc50a>Q, E, PgUp and PgDn</color> keys to rotate and zoom the camera.
This is your <color=#ffc50a>Home Crystal</color>. Protect it at all costs!

- Click on the <color=#ffc50a>Pickaxe</color> on the left side of your screen. \n
- Select the <color=#ffc50a>Harvest Trees task</color>. \n
- Place it on some trees. \n
- Click on the <color=#00ff15>green checkmark</color> at the bottom left of your screen, or press <color=#ffc50a>"Tab"</color> to confirm. \n
Your Bricktrons will automatically start harvesting some wood for you!

- Select the <color=#ffc50a>Structures tab</color> on the left side of your screen. \n 
- In the <color=#ffc50a>Production</color> section, select the <color=#ffc50a>Chopping Block</color>. \n
- Place it on the ground. \n
You can <color=#ffc50a>delete blueprints</color> by <color=#ffc50a>ctrl + clicking</color> on the blueprint when in edit mode. \n
- Click on the <color=#00ff15>green checkmark</color> at the bottom left of your screen, or press <color=#ffc50a>"Tab"</color> to confirm. \n
Bricktrons will automatically begin to haul logs to the chopping block and <color=#ffc50a>produce planks</color>.

- Select the <color=#ffc50a>Structures tab</color> on the left side of your screen. \n 
- In the <color=#ffc50a>Storage</color> section, select the <color=#ffc50a>Stockpile</color>. \n
- Place several on the ground by clicking several times, or dragging across a flat surface. \n
You can <color=#ffc50a>delete blueprints</color> by <color=#ffc50a>ctrl + clicking</color> on the blueprint when in build mode. \n
- Click on the <color=#00ff15>green checkmark</color> at the bottom left of your screen, or press <color=#ffc50a>"Tab"</color> to confirm. \n
If your Bricktrons won't work, make sure you have empty stockpiles.

- Click on the <color=#ffc50a>Pickaxe</color> on the left side of your screen. 

- Select the <color=#ffc50a>Quarry task</color>. 

- Place it on <color=##fc50a>empty ground</color>. 

- Click on the <color=#00ff15>green checkmark</color> at the bottom left of your screen, or press <color=#ffc50a>"Tab"</color> to confirm. 

When a stockpile is <color=#ffc50a>completely filled with stone</color>, the stone will turn into <color=#ffc50a>4 bricks</color>.

Here are some useful construction tips. \n
You can <color=#ffc50a>rotate blueprints</color> before placing them them by <color=#ffc50a>right-clicking</color>. \n
You can <color=#ffc50a>delete blueprints</color> by <color=#ffc50a>ctrl + clicking</color> on the blueprint when in edit mode. \n
You can ask Bricktrons to <color=#ffc50a>destroy a construction</color> by <color=#ffc50a>ctrl + clicking</color> on it when in a build task. \n
You can <color=#ffc50a>duplicate, move, and manipulate blueprints</color> by using the Blueprints tool in the Plans tab on the left middle side of your screen when in a build task.

- Select the <color=#ffc50a>Structures tab</color> on the left side of your screen. \n 
- Select the <color=#ffc50a>Furnace</color>. \n
- Place one by clicking on the ground. \n
You can <color=#ffc50a>rotate blueprints</color> before placing them them by <color=#ffc50a>right-clicking</color>. \n
- Click on the <color=#00ff15>green checkmark</color> at the bottom left of your screen, or press <color=#ffc50a>"Tab"</color> to confirm. \n
With a furnace, you can now use iron ore and brimstone to obtain iron ingots.

Iron and Brimstone are useful to produce iron ingots, wards and other items and structures. \n Harvest some iron AND brimstone. \n - Click on the Pickaxe on the left side of your screen. \n - Select the Iron or Brimstone harvest task. \n - Place it on a patch of iron or brimstone. \n - Confirm. \n You need to gather both iron and brimstone to complete this objective. \n Make sure to have available stockpiles!

- Make sure you have planks in one of your stockpiles. \n
- Select the <color=#ffc50a>Structures</color> tab. \n 
- In the <color=#ffc50a>Crafting</color> section, select the <color=#ffc50a>Workbench</color>. \n
- Place it on the ground. \n
- <color=#00ff15>Confirm</color>. \n
The workbench will allow you to craft archer and halberdier kits.

- Select your <color=#ffc50a>furnace</color>. \n 
- A pop-up menu will open at the bottom of your screen. \n
- <color=#ffc50a>Click on the Iron ingot.</color> \n
- You can queue multiple ingots. \n
<color=#ffc50a> Make sure to have an empty stockpile to store your ingots.</color>

- Make sure you have planks in one of your stockpiles. \n
- Select the <color=#ffc50a>Structures tab</color>. \n 
- In the Storage section, select the <color=#ffc50a>Weapon Rack</color>. \n
- Place it on the ground. \n
- <color=#00ff15>Confirm</color>. \n
The Bricktrons will store unused or newly crafted military equipment in the weapon rack.

- <color=#ffc50a>Select your workbench.</color> \n
- At the bottom of your screen, with the workbench pop-up, you can select what you want to craft. \n
- Click on the <color=#ffc50a>Halberdier Kit</color> to begin production. \n
- You can queue multiple kits by clicking on the Halberdier kit again. \n
<color=#ffc50a> Make sure to have an empty weapon rack to store your kits.</color> \n
A weapon racks can only hold <color=#ffc50a>4 military kits of a single type at once.</color>

- Select a <color=#ffc50a>Bricktron</color>. \n
- <color=#ffc50a>Right-click</color> (don't hold right-click) on the <color=#ffc50a>weapon rack containing the Halberdier Kit</color>. \n
To unequip the kit, select the Halberdier and right-click an empty weapon stand or one that contains 3 or less Halberdier kits.

The world of Castle Story has a <color=#ffc50a>Day / Night cycle</color>. \n
Fortunately, you can build <color=#ffc50a>Lanterns</color> to provide light and vision. \n
- Select the <color=#ffc50a>Workbench</color> and open the pie menu.
- Choose the <color=#ffc50a>Lantern</color>. \n
You will need an iron ingot and brimstone to craft a lantern.

Once you have stockpiled one or more <color=#ffc50a>Lanterns</color>, the easiest way to place them is with the <color=#ffc50a>Structures</color> tab. \n
Place a lantern blueprint where you want your Bricktrons to build it. They will carry it from the stockpile to the blueprint. \n
Optionally, link your lanterns to your home crystal with Pylons to make them shine brighter.

- Select the <color=#ffc50a>Stone Blocks</color> tab. \n
- Select the <color=#ffc50a>Brick</color>. \n
You can now place them on the ground or on top of each other to start building walls! Don't hesitate to use the other blocks to make more complex structures too.
<color=#ffa500ff>Build walls directly around your home crystal to protect it from Corruptrons.</color>

The Loom will allow you to refine plant fiber into rope and fabric, which are useful for military kits. \n
- Place a <color=#ffc50a>plant harvest task</color> over some plants and <color=#00ff15>confirm it</color>. \n
<color=#ffc50a>Make sure you have empty stockpiles to store the plants.</color> \n
- Place a <color=#ffc50a>loom blueprint</color> and <color=#00ff15>confirm it</color>. You'll find it under the structures tab under the Production section.

Now that you have plant fiber, lets make some rope and fabric. \n
- Select the loom. \n
- At the bottom of your screen, with the loom pop-up, you can select what you want to craft. \n
- Click on the <color=#ffc50a>Rope</color> to craft one rope coil. \n
Once you have some rope, select the loom again and click on the <color=#ffc50a>Fabric</color> to craft one fabric roll. \n
<color=#ffc50a>Make sure you have empty stockpiles to store both the fabric and the rope.</color>

- Select your workbench. \n
- At the bottom of your screen, with the workbench pop-up, you can select what you want to craft. \n
- Click on the <color=#ffc50a>Archer Kit</color> to begin production. \n
- You can queue multiple kits by clicking on the Archer kit again. \n
<color=#ffc50a> Make sure to have an empty weapon rack to store your kits.</color> \n
A weapon racks can only hold <color=#ffc50a>4 military kits of a single type at once.</color>

- Select a <color=#ffc50a>Bricktron</color>. \n
- <color=#ffc50a>Right-click</color> (don't hold right-click) on the <color=#ffc50a>weapon rack containing the Archer Kit</color>. \n
To unequip the kit, select the Archer and right-click an empty weapon rack or one that contains 3 or less Archer kits!

To Spawn additionnal Bricktrons, you need to collect <color=#ffc50a>Wisps</color>. You can see your total number of wisps in the panel on the bottom left side of your screen. 

Once that bar is full, you will see a <color=#ffc50a>Yellow Wisp</color> floating around your main crystal. 

- To spawn a Bricktron, <color=#ffc50a>click</color> on the <color=#ffc50a>Bricktron icon</color> next to the progressing bar.

If you need more help, check out the help panel by clicking on the question mark at the top right of your screen. \n
You can also visit the official Castle Story wiki on <color=#ffc50a>http://wiki.castlestory.net</color> \n
You can find other players to chat with on the official Castle Story Discord at <color=#ffc50a>http://castlestory.net/Discord</color>

This next section Will show you how to craft other military units and discuss more advanced aspects of the game. \n 
<color=#ffc50a>You can end this tutorial at any moment by turning it off in the options menu (F10)</color>.

You are now free to continue to explore the game! \n
Want to put your Bricktrons to the test? Then press the <color=#ffc50a>Send Corruptron Wave button</color> on the <color=#ffc50a>left side of your screen</color>. \n
This will send a wave of Corruptrons to attack your crystal. \n
Try and see how many waves you can defeat!
<color=#ff0064><size=12>You need more empty stockpiles!</size></color> Build additionnal stockpiles to continue harvesting resources.
<color=#ff0064><size=12>You have too many tasks!</size></color> Delete some of your existing tasks to place new ones.
To disable these help popups, go in general options by pressing F10

Keys: Insert new tutorial sidebar strings below

English (Canada):
In this tutorial, we will teach you the basics of playing the game.

Castle Story is a complex game, so we recommend following it in it's entirety before diving deeper in other game modes. 

<color=#ffc50a>Let's get started!</color>
<color=#ffc50a>Pro tip: </color>if you do not want to see this tutorial, open the main menu and disable the tutorial in <color=#ffc50a>options / general > disable tooltips.</color>
This is your Home Crystal. Defend it at all costs!
<color=#ffc50a>Bricktrons</color> are friendly yellow creatures that will follow your orders. You can give them direct orders, or place down tasks that they will choose to do on their own.

The <color=#ffc50a>Home Crystal</color> is the heart of your civilization. You must defend it at all costs from marauding creatures or rival bricktron villages.\n\nThe Home Crystal is also <color=#ffc50a> your source of power</color>, and <color=#ffc50a>the only place to get more Bricktrons</color>.
Use the <color=#ffc50a>#hotkeys</color> keys to move the camera horizontally.
<color=#ffc50a>Pro tip:</color> You can also enable screen edge nudge in options / gameplay
Use <color=#ffc50a>#hotkeys</color> or <color=#ffc50a>Middle Mouse Button</color> to rotate the camera around the pivot.
Use <color=#ffc50a>#hotkeys</color> or the <color=#ffc50a>Mouse Scroll Wheel</color> to zoom in and out.
Use <color=#ffc50a>Shift + Scroll Wheel</color> or <color=#ffc50a>#hotkeys</color> to change the elevation of the camera pivot.
<color=#ffc50a>Pro tip:</color> You can force <color=#ffc50a>auto-ground-hug by pressing #hotkeys</color>.

Use the <color=#ffc50a>Left Mouse Button</color> to select a Bricktron.

You can also <color=#ffc50a>Drag Select</color> to select multiple Bricktrons.

Once a Bricktron is selected a yellow circle will appear beneath its feet.
<color=#ffc50a>Pro tip :</color> If you <color=#ffc50a>Double Click</color> on a Bricktron, it will select all the Bricktrons of the same class (ie: workers, archers, knights, etc.)

With a selected Bricktron, <color=#ffc50a>Right Click</color> on the ground to give it a <color=#ffc50a>Move Order</color>.

If you <color=#ffc50a>Control + Right Click</color> on the ground, this will issue a <color=#ffc50a>Dig Order</color>.

<color=#ffc50a>Control + Right Click</color> on bricks or structures will issue a <color=#ffc50a>Destroy Order</color>.

In Castle Story, you gather resource by placing down tasks. Left to themselves, Bricktrons will choose tasks based on priority, but you can also reassign them.

<color=#ffc50a>Wood is the first resource you will want to gather</color>.

Let's cut some trees!

<color=#ffc50a>Press the Tasks button</color> at the center left of the screen, and choose the <color=#ffc50a>Harvest Wood task</color>.

<color=#ffc50a>Click on a patch of trees</color>. You should see a yellow circle appear, highlighting all the trees in it.

<color=#ffc50a>Press Tab</color> or the <color=#00ff15>Green Checkmark</color> to activate the task.

<color=#ffc50a>Pro tip:</color> You can <color=#ffc50a>change the radius</color> of the harvest tasks by click-dragging the yellow circle or <color=#ffc50a>move the center</color> by dragging the pin in the middle.
Create a harvest wood task to continue
Now, you have a bunch of logs, but your Bricktrons don't know what to do with them.\n\nLet's create a <color=#ffc50a>Chopping Block</color> to transform them into <color=#ffc50a>planks</color>!

<color=#ffc50a>Press the Structures button</color> at the center left of the screen, and choose the <color=#ffc50a>Chopping Block</color>.

<color=#ffc50a>Click on the ground</color> to place your structure. You should see the blueprint of a Chopping Block appear on the ground.

<color=#ffc50a>Press Tab</color> or the <color=#00ff15>Green Checkmark</color> to apply the blueprint.

One of your Bricktrons should immediately grab a log and place it on the blueprint to create the chopping block.
Create a Chopping Block to continue

Most resources need to be stockpiled for Bricktrons to be able to use them.\n\nStockpiles are needed to do that. In fact, <color=#ffc50a>you will need A LOT of stockpiles to run a village efficiently</color>.

<color=#ffc50a>Press the Structures button</color>, and choose the <color=#ffc50a>Stockpile</color> in the storage section.

<color=#ffc50a>Place some stockpiles</color> on the ground.

<color=#ffc50a>Press Tab to confirm the new blueprints</color>.
<color=#ffc50a>Pro tip :</color> Several blueprints can be placed on the groud at once by <color=#ffc50a>click-dragging</color>. This is much more efficient than clicking them individually.
You can see that a stockpile <color=#ffc50a>requires 1 plank to build</color> and that it can <color=#ffc50a>contain up to 12 planks</color>.

Right now, your village is completely defenseless. This is a problem we should fix, don't you think?

<color=#ffc50a>Let's create some weapons!</color>

For that <color=#ffc50a>we'll need metal</color>.

Just like harvesting trees, to get raw Iron, <color=#ffc50a>go to the task tab</color>, find the <color=#ffc50a>harvest iron task</color>, and, <color=#ffc50a>place it on a nearby patch of iron</color>.

<color=#ffc50a>Press Tab</color> to confirm the task placement.

We will also need to melt that metal into ingots. Brimstone is the resource we need.

Go to the <color=#ffc50a>task tab</color>, click on <color=#ffc50a>harvest brimstone</color>, and <color=#ffc50a>place it on a nearby patch of brimstone</color>.

<color=#ffc50a>Press Tab</color> to confirm the task placement.
Gather Iron and Brimstone to continue
To melt the iron using brimstone, we will need to build <color=#ffc50a>a Furnace</color>. Furnaces require stone bricks.\n\nLet's harvest stone to make bricks!

In the <color=#ffc50a>tasks tab</color>, click <color=#ffc50a>harvest stone</color>, and place it <color=#ffc50a>on a nearby patch of boulders</color>.\n\nYour bricktrons should now gather all the resources needed to build your furnace and produce iron ingots. Awesome!

In the <color=#ffc50a>structures tab</color>, click on the <color=#ffc50a>furnace</color>, and place its blueprint on the ground anywhere.\n\n<color=#ffc50a>Press Tab</color> or click on the <color=#00ff15>Green Checkmark</color> to confirm the new blueprint.
<color=#ffc50a>Pro tip: A Furnace requires 4 bricks</color> to be built. Make sure you have filled at least one stockpile with stone.
Once your furnace is built, <color=#ffc50a>click on it</color>.\n\nThe furnace tab should appear in the taskbar at the bottom of your screen.
Click on the iron ingot button to add it the the queue. Click on it 5 times to <color=#ffc50a>queue 6 ingots</color>.

<color=#ffc50a>Pro tip :</color> If you want to produce an infinite quantity of ingots, <color=#ffc50a>click on the cycle</color> button to <color=#ffc50a>loop the current queue forever</color> until you have no more resources or your stockpiles are full.
Use the furnace to queue iron ingots.
<color=#ffc50a>The workbench</color> is the most basic crafting station, it can craft halberdier kits, archer kits and lanterns.\n\nLet's craft a halberdier kit!
In the <color=#ffc50a>structures tab</color>, click on <color=#ffc50a>workbench</color>, and place it <color=#ffc50a>on the ground anywhere</color>.
<color=#ffc50a>Pro tip :</color> If you want your workbench to face a specific direction, <color=#ffc50a>blueprints can be rotated with Right-Click</color>.
Before we move on and create the halberdier kit, we'll need to create a weapon rack to store it.
Before we create our <color=#ffc50a>halberdier kit</color>, we need a <color=#ffc50a>weapon rack</color> to store it.

In the <color=#ffc50a>stuctures tab</color>, click on the <color=#ffc50a>weapon rack</color>, and place it <color=#ffc50a>on the ground anywhere</color>.\n\nEach weapon rack can contain up to <color=#ffc50a>4 kits of the same class.</color>
<color=#ffc50a>Pro tip:</color> To allow your Bricktrons to access the military kits faster, make sure to leave enough space on <color=#ffc50a>both sides of the weapon rack</color>!
Create a weapon rack to continue

Find your <color=#ffc50a>workbench</color> and <color=#ffc50a>click on it.</color>\n
In the taskbar popup, click on <color=#ffc50a>Halberdier Kit.</color> \n
A Bricktron will soon start working on the kit. The worker will craft 2 pieces: <color=#ffc50a>a Halberd</color> and <color=#ffc50a>a Helmet.</color> The pieces will each be stored in the weapon rack.
Pro tip: <color=#ffc50a>You need space in a weapon rack for the kit to be crafted.</color>
Once those two pieces are stored in the weapon rack, <color=#ffc50a>select a Bricktron</color> and <color=#ffc50a>right-click on the rack</color>. Congratulations, you have your first soldier!
<color=#ffc50a>Pro tip:</color> Soldiers cannot be assigned to tasks, and cannot carry stuff around.
Use the Workbench to queue a halberdier kit.
Let's craft an archer kit! <color=#ffc50a>We will need Rope, Fabric and Planks.</color>
Rope and fabric are made with plant fiber. Place a harvest plants task on a nerby patch of ferns.
<color=#ffc50a>Pro tip: make sure you have empty stockpiles for the plants</color>.

The plants will need to be transformed into rope and fabric using a Loom. In the structures tabs, <color=#ffc50a>select a Loom,</color> and place it anywhere. \n\nOnce the loom is built, click on it, and <color=#ffc50a>queue 1 fabric roll, and 1 rope coil</color> in the taskbar popup.
In the workbench, <color=#ffc50a>queue 1 archer kit.</color> If you have the required resources, a worker should get started immediately.
Equip an archer kit to continue
Use the workbench to queue an archer kit.

<color=#ffc50a>Your home crystal generates energy passively.</color> This energy can be used to spawn new Bricktrons. 

You can see this energy in the form of <color=#3a7bff>blue wisps</color> orbiting your home crystal. Once you have enough blue wisps, they will merge together to create a <color=#ffc50a>bright yellow wisp.</color>

You can see how much energy you have and how much is needed for the next Bricktron in the taskbar to popup above your home crystal.
<color=#ffc50a>Click on the spawn a new Bricktron button</color> in the taskbar popup. A worker should appear instantly near your Home Crystal
<color=#ffc50a>Pro tip:</color> You can <color=#ffc50a>capture shards around the map</color> to help generate more energy.
Spawn a new Bricktron to continue
Open up the pie menu on your crystal or select the Idle task to spawn a new Bricktron.

Now that your village grew larger, let's create some walls to protect them. \n
<color=#ffc50a>We will need stone to make bricks</color>, lots of them! Let's make a quarry to gather more stone.
In the new tasks menu, <color=#ffc50a>select Quarry.</color>\n\nNow <color=#ffc50a>click on an empty patch of ground</color> to place the quarry. A yellow outline of a hole in the ground will appear.
<color=#ffc50a>Pro tip: Don't place your quarry on an existing structure or too close to your home crystal.</color> The Bricktons will either destroy the structures, or fail to dig the ground.

You can <color=#ffc50a>move or change the dimensions</color> of the quarry by dragging the handles on the sides of the volume.\nYou can <color=#ffc50a>rotate the placement of the strairwell</color> in the taskbar popup.\n<color=#ffc50a>Press Tab</color> or the <color=#00ff15>Green Checkmark</color> to activate the new quarry.
Let's place down some blueprint to create a wall!

Click on the <color=#ffc50a>Brick menu</color> at the center left of the screen. Choose <color=#ffc50a>Standard brick.</color>Hover on the ground with your mouse will reveal a blue outline of a brick. This is a <color=#ffc50a>blueprint</color> 
<color=#ffc50a>Left-Click</color> once to place the brick. 
<color=#ffc50a>Right-Click</color> to rotate your blueprint. 
<color=#ffc50a>Drag-Click</color> to place an entire row of bricks. 
<color=#ffc50a>Ctrl-Click</color> on a blueprint to remove it.
<color=#ffc50a>Pro tip:</color> You are in the blueprint mode while placing bricks. <color=#ffc50a>You cannot select Bricktrons or click on anything while in this mode</color>.
<color=#ffc50a>Press Tab</color> or the <color=#00ff15>Green Checkmark</color> to confirm the new blueprints and exit blueprint mode.
Build a wall around your home crystal to protect it from Corruptrons!

Walls are much better at defending your Bricktrons if you can't simply walk around them. So <color=#ffc50a>the best walls should have at least 2 bricks high,</color> and should have no holes in them. \n\nOf course, now your Bricktrons won't be able to come in and out of your castle. Let's add a door for them.

To create a door, <color=#ffc50a>make sure you have Planks and Iron ingots.</color> \n
Click on the <color=#ffc50a>structure button, choose the Door</color>, and place it where you want the castle's entrance to be.
<color=#ffc50a>Pro tip:</color> If you must place a door in an existing blueprint wall, <color=#ffc50a>Ctrl+Click</color> on the blueprints to create a hole and then place the door.

If needed, go back to the bricks tab and complete the wall around the door with bricks & half-bricks.\n\n<color=#ffc50a>Press Tab</color> or the <color=#00ff15>Green Checkmark</color> to confirm the new blueprints.
It should be getting dark soon, if not already! You will want to illuminate your castle so you can keep working.

<color=#ffc50a>Lanterns are crafted in the workbench.

They require 1 brimstones and 1 iron ingot.</color>

Once crafted they will be stored in a stockpile, so make sure you have an empty stockpile in your base!

Open the structure tab, select the lantern, and place a lantern blueprint anywhere.
<color=#ffc50a>Pro tip:</color> Lanterns can be placed directly on walls or on the ground. The choice is yours!
<color=#ffc50a>Press Tab</color> or the <color=#00ff15>Green Checkmark</color> to confirm the new blueprints.

This is the end of this tutorial! 

There are undoubtedly many more things you'd like to learn; the world of Castle Story is wide, complex and full of mysteries, secrets and intricate details. We do have some external references for you to learn more about the game.

Check out (and maybe contribute to?) the official Wiki: 
 <color=#ffc50a>http://wiki.castlestory.net</color> 

Our Youtube channel's "How To" playlist also has helpful videos: 
 <color=#ffc50a>http://youtube.com/SauropodStudio</color> 

You can also ask fellow players in live chat on our official Discord: 
 <color=#ffc50a>http://castlestory.net/Discord</color> 

Have fun exploring the great world of Castle Story!

Certain tools in this Debug panel may cause a drop in performance or break the game. Use it at your own risk and consider backing up your save file first.
The game mode for creatives and pacifists. No enemies means you can build anything you want at your own pace.

This is Sandbox mode. In this mode, your creativity's the limit! There is no time limit and no Corruptrons, so you can build without worry. Use this time to explore the game and practice the art of castle building. Have fun!
Hordes of marauding corruptrons roam the land. Can you muster enough forces to kick them off your island?

The corruptrons have made landfall on this island. In no time,
they will have spread their corrupting influence over all of the island's magical crystals.
Only you can stop their advance.

Are you up to the challenge?

You have crushed the opposing factions. Your masterful building and strategy have given your Bricktrons the upper hand and they now control the Islands. You will forever be remembered as a glorious leader.

Your enemies have conquered your home Crystal. 
Most of your Bricktrons have been defeated and the surviving ones have been exiled. They now seek new horizons and a new island to call home.
Corruptrons attack your castle in waves of increasing difficulty. How long will you last? Skill and determination are your best weapons.

Your time is limited.

Hordes of marauding Corruptrons are at your doorstep.
Each wave of Corruptrons will get increasingly diffcult.
Your only option is to erect fortifications around your home crystal and brace yourself.

Good luck!

You have demonstrated that you could withstand any reasonably sized corruptron assault. You have officially won the Invasion game mode. You can keep playing if you want, but the increasing number of ennemies will eventually impact the game performance and unravel the very fabric of the bricktron world.
Henceforth, The once glorious lands upon which the Bricktrons thrived becometh a territory governed by the ruthless Corruptrons.
Create a new map from scratch
Legend has it that these floating islands contain the lost souls of 30 000 backers. These souls, trapped within layers of solid rock, are awaiting the day where they will be set free!
Grab the Gems is a multiplayer game mode in which you must bring back gems to your home crystal. The team that brings back the most gems to their crystal wins!

Grab the Gems is a gamemode where, in order to win, you must be the first faction to collect #gems_to_win gems and drop them at your home crystal.
Pick up gems by selecting a worker and right-clicking a gem that has appeared in its patch. Drop the gem in your crystal by right-clicking it with the worker selected.
Consider defending patches of gems and hunting down enemy workers who are hauling gems back to their base.
Have fun and good luck!
You have managed to collect #gem_count gem!
You have managed to collect #gem_count gems!
You are victorious! You were the first faction to collect all the needed gems. Fabulous! Outrageous!

You have been defeated.\n
Another faction has managed to collect the needed gems before you.\n
May your powerless, gemless Bricktrons live in shame until you once again seize the opportunity to prove yourself!
Gems will take more time to spawn

Hold right-click on various objects such as the furnace to get a contextual menu. The menu will offer different actions depending on what is selected or hovered.
Shift + Right-Click with military units selected to order them to move-attack.
Join the official Discord to find fellow Castle Story players! www.castlestory.net/Discord
Replenish an Alchemist’s ammo by selecting the unit and right-clicking a stockpile with bombs.
Build bear traps on chokepoints to slow enemies down and allow ranged units to take them out before they reach your castle.
You can only change the position of a quarry’s stairs before confirming the task, by clicking the button in the options panel at the bottom of your screen.
You can make tunnels go upwards or downwards with the buttons in the options panel at the bottom of your screen, when in the Tunnel task.
Turn on X-Ray mode in the settings panel at the top right of your screen, then shift + scroll to see through buildings and mountains.
Place a repair task on existing stone and wooden blocks to automatically have them repaired if they take damage.
If your Bricktrons won’t work, make sure you have adequate storage ( empty stockpiles or weapon racks ).
Press H to toggle your Artificer between healing and attacking modes.
Press H to toggle your Knights between regular and defensive mode, where they can block projectiles.
Bricktrons prefer to be called by their first name.
Once two bricktrons are friends, they are friends forever, or until you reboot your computer.
Bricktrons have subtle yet refined courtship rituals.
Bricktrons lost the ability to talk intelligibly after they built a tower a little too high.
Bricktrons don't recognize their image in a mirror.
The type of hats worn by bricktron archers is historically known as a bycocket. No kidding, look it up.
Archers and arbalists gain a range buff when higher. Place them on top of your walls.
Use the pie menu on stockpiles to restrict which resources go on them.
You can use the flatten task to flatten uneven areas.
You can build longer wood beams if you use braces beneath the beams.
Can be turned into planks at a chopping block.
Main resource used to build wooden structures.
Raw stone can be combined to form stone bricks or smelted into glass.
Can be forged into various equipment, including weapons, armor and cogs.
Is it making a come back??
Serves as fuel for the furnace and is used in the concoction of explosives.

Any Bricktron in this ward's radius of influence will be healed over time.

This ward emits light. It will emit more light when connected to a power source.
This ward relays power to other wards.

Is used in the fabrication of rope bridges and bows.
Is required for crafting most military equipment.
Unrefined iron ore which can be smelted into ingots.
Used to craft the goods that come out of the laboratory.
Used to make the machine shop and crossbows.
Serves as ammunition for the alchemist.
Serves as ammunition for the catapult.

Used to craft the goods that come out of the laboratory.

Serves as ammunition for the catapult.

Main resource used to build wooden structures.

Knights are slow but robust melee units, their block ability excels against projectiles.
Archers are inexpensive, versatile long range units.
Arbalists are slower, but deal high damage at a very long range.
Halberdiers are inexpensive melee combatants with high speed.
Alchemists throw bombs that deal area of effect damage and break walls.
Artificers can either throw ranged projectiles with their staff or heal allies.
The crafting station will produce the selected item indefinitely.
The workbench is used to craft lanterns, halberdier kits and archer kits.
Refine wood logs into planks at this station.
Anything related to explosions can be crafted at this station, like explosive barrels, bombs and alchemist kits.
The loom allows you to refine plants into fabric and rope.
The forge enables metalworking, turning iron ingots into knight kits or cogs.
Contraptions requiring mechanical components like beartraps and arbalist kits can be crafted here.
Items drawing from the mysterious energy emanating from crystals are built here, including wards and artificer kits.
<color=#ffc50a>Quarry</color>\n\nTask for digging downward and harvesting rock.

<color=#ffc50a>Lower</color>\n\nOrders the Bricktrons to lower the terrain at selected location

<color=#ffc50a>Voxels</color>\n\nNumber of voxels projected to be removed

The Decorations & Winter Biome update is now live, adding lots of new blocks to the game; new pillars, paintings, a statue, windows, doors AND a brand new snowy biome to play and make maps with!\n\nEnjoy!
Capture the Pumpkins is a multiplayer game mode in which you must bring back pumpkins to your cooking pot. The team that brings back the most pumpkins to their cooking pot wins!

Capture the Pumpkins is a gamemode where, in order to win, you must be the first faction to collect #gems_to_win gems and drop them at your cooking pot.
Pick up pumpkins by selecting a worker and right-clicking a pumpkin that has appeared in its patch. Drop this delicious squash in your cooking pot by right-clicking it with the worker selected.
Consider defending patches of pumpkins and hunting down enemy workers who are hauling them back to their base.
Have fun and good luck!
You have managed to collect #gem_count pumpkin!
You have managed to collect #gem_count pumpkins!
You are victorious! You were the first faction to collect all the needed pumpkins. Fabulous! Outrageous!

You have been defeated.\n
Another faction has managed to collect the needed pumpkins before you.\n
May your powerless, squashless Bricktrons live in shame until you once again seize the opportunity to prove yourself!

It's the return of the Halloween event! Once again, this year, Grab the Gems gets a healthy dash of spooky! Gems turned into pumpkins, your crystal is a bubbly cauldron and the moon doesn't look quite right! If you haven't tried the Grab the Gems/Capture the Pumpkin gamemode, be sure to give it a try, it's tons of fun!

You'll also notice the Bricktrons have put on their best costumes! Share a screenshot of your favorite one on social media with the tag #castlestory!

Happy Halloween!

-Team Sauropod
